definition: to take advantage of the new situation (idiom)/to make the best of new opportunities

sentences.english: He had a definite strain of snobbery in him.
sentences.chinese: 他这个人明显有一股势利小人的气味。

sentences.english: The philistine is often a snob.
Music snobbery is a cornerstone of indie music.
sentences.chinese: 音乐势利是独立音乐的里程碑。

sentences.english: He disdained that man for snobbishness and was unwilling to talk to him.
sentences.chinese: 他鄙视那个势利小人，不愿和他说话。

sentences.english: The malefic influences, of this snobbery are rapidly spreading all over the world.
sentences.chinese: 这种势利的有害影响正迅速扩散到全世界。

sentences.english: 13-5 The value of art-snobbery, to living artists, is considerable.
sentences.chinese: 艺术势利感对活着的艺术家具有极大的价值。

sentences.english: Too much money causes some people to become snobbish.
sentences.chinese: 太多钱使有些人变成势利眼。

sentences.english: I do not see this author as trustworthy it seems as if they have a snobby attitude.
sentences.chinese: 我并不认为怀揣着如此势利态度的广告值得信赖。

sentences.english: One shouldn't be too snobbish, as snobs are hated by all people.
sentences.chinese: 做人不能太势利眼了，嫌贫爱富的人让人痛恨。

sentences.english: In practice, what they do is take away some of the snobbery from education.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，他们所做的是从教育中剔除某些势利课程。

sentences.english: There are certain disfiguring and mortal diseases about which there has probably never been any snobbery.
sentences.chinese: 也许对某些毁容或致命地疾病从来没有使人感到势利。

sentences.english: There is also a snobbishness is in with a small advantage.
sentences.chinese: 还有一种势利是小气中带着实利。

sentences.english: "Building forces upon advantageous basis", this strategy of war emphasizes the necessity of leading by trend, only flexibility in fighting may conquer the enemy and win.
sentences.chinese: 的战略原则，强调因势利导，弹性用兵方能克敌制胜。

sentences.english: Snobs are usually contemptuous of people they feel to be beneath them.
sentences.chinese: 势利者通常瞧不起他们认为地位在他们之下的人。

sentences.english: The people I respect are straightforward ones; the ones I hate are snobs.
sentences.chinese: 我崇敬的是光明磊落的人，痛恨的是势利小人。

definition: to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
unkind/harsh/cutting/mean/acrimony/to embezzle by making illegal deductions
to favor the rich and disdain the poor (idiom)/snobbish
to seek nothing but profit (idiom); personal profit before everything/self-seeking
to think of oneself as high and pure (idiom); smug and self-righteous/holier-than-thou
to open one's eyes wide at the sight of profit (idiom); thinking of nothing but personal gain/money-grubbing
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to cling to the powerful and rich (idiom); social climbing
everything for self and selfish profit (idiom); with no regard for others/selfish/mercenary
